Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    The card class creates a card object that contains a suit, a number, and a image that corresponds to that suit and number. It is used in hand, deck and memory.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Card(Suit theSuit, int theNum)
      Card constructor that makes a new card based on the suit and number, used for defining a card for comparisons that will not actually be displayed
      Card(Suit theSuit, int theNum, int screenRes)
      Card constructor that make a new card based on suit, number and screen resolution.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(java.lang.Object secondCard)
      compare to compares two card objects, it first checks the suit.
      static int compareTo2(java.lang.Object firstCard, java.lang.Object secondCard)
      The compare to 2 method is different from that of the first compare to, because it sets all suits besides spade as the equal to each other, and instead of comparing it to "this", it takes in two Card parameters.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Compares two cards to see if their suit and number are equal.
      javax.swing.ImageIcon getImage()
      Gets the image of the card
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the cards name based on its suit and number.
      int getNumber()
      Returns this cards number.
      Suit getSuit()
      Returns this cards suit.
      void setScreenRes(int screenRes)
      Allows the screenResolution of the card to be changed, so the size of the card's image is changed appropriately
      java.lang.String toString()
      Prints the name of the card using the getName method

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(Suit theSuit,
            int theNum,
            int screenRes)
        Card constructor that make a new card based on suit, number and screen resolution.
        Parameters:
        theSuit - the suit of the card, of the enumerated type Suit, defined in the Suit class, either Spade, Club, Diamond or Heart
        theNum - the number of the card, 1-13
        screenRes - the screen resolution of the game, either 0 or 1

      • Card

        public Card(Suit theSuit,
            int theNum)
        Card constructor that makes a new card based on the suit and number, used for defining a card for comparisons that will not actually be displayed
        Parameters:
        theSuit - the suit of the card.
        theNum - the number of the card.

    • Method Detail

      • getSuit

        public Suit getSuit()
        Returns this cards suit.
        Returns:
        the suit of the card.

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber()
        Returns this cards number.
        Returns:
        the number of the card.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares two cards to see if their suit and number are equal. Do not need to be the same card object
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - A card object to compare with this card.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the cards name based on its suit and number.
        Returns:
        the name of the card "____ of ____", for example "Ace of Hearts"

      • getImage

        public javax.swing.ImageIcon getImage()
        Gets the image of the card
        Returns:
        An ImageIcon holding the card image

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints the name of the card using the getName method
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • setScreenRes

        public void setScreenRes(int screenRes)
        Allows the screenResolution of the card to be changed, so the size of the card's image is changed appropriately
        Parameters:
        screenRes - 0 if high resolution, 1 if low resolution

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object secondCard)
        compare to compares two card objects, it first checks the suit. Spade being the highest, diamond second, club third and heart last.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Parameters:
        secondCard - the second card to compare to the first.
        Returns:
        if "this" is smaller, -1 is returned, else 1 is returned.

      • compareTo2

        public static int compareTo2(java.lang.Object firstCard,
                             java.lang.Object secondCard)
        The compare to 2 method is different from that of the first compare to, because it sets all suits besides spade as the equal to each other, and instead of comparing it to "this", it takes in two Card parameters.
        Parameters:
        firstCard - the first card to compare
        secondCard - the second card to compare
        Returns:
        1 if first card is bigger, -1 if second card is bigger.
